strategy_reasoning: Uses the 'cozy pixel art garden' metaphor to make technical updates (API consistency, cost tracking) feel like tending to a digital ecosystem. The retro game UI aesthetic appeals to the developer/indie-hacker demographic while maintaining the warm, approachable Pollinations brand.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art title card. A cute 8-bit bee character hovering over a glowing lime green (#ecf874) digital flower. Text 'GARDEN UPDATES' in chunky white pixel font at the top. Soft lavender and peach gradient background. Warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic like A Short Hike. Wholesome and inviting.
images.description: Cover image establishing the cozy garden theme

images.prompt: Retro game UI 'New Items Unlocked' screen. Pixel art style. Two main icons: 1. A magical pixel art quill pen (representing Shaper AI). 2. A framed painting turning into a film strip (representing Veo Image-to-Video). Background is a soft mint and lime green (#ecf874) checkerboard. 8-bit aesthetic, clean and cute like Unpacking.
images.description: Highlighting the new features (Shaper AI and Veo) as unlockable game items

images.prompt: Pixel art scene of a tiny developer character fixing a wooden signpost. The sign points left to 'Old Garden' and right to 'New Beta'. In the sky, a retro 'Energy Bar' UI element is being refilled (representing cost tracking). Soft pastel sunset background. Stardew Valley vibes, chunky pixels, warm and nostalgic.
images.description: Visualizing the maintenance updates: the beta banner link and the cost tracking fix

caption:

alt_text: A series of cozy 8-bit pixel art images. 1. A cute bee tending a lime green digital flower. 2. A retro game inventory screen showing a magic quill and a film strip. 3. A pixel character fixing a wooden signpost under a pastel sunset.
